- Enhancement pattern consistent with WHO Grade II meningioma

Given patient's occupation as a data scientist requiring high cognitive function, symptoms suggesting increased ICP, and imaging characteristics, immediate surgical intervention recommended. WHO Grade II suspected based on imaging features.

clinical_notes.aggressive:
NEUROSURGICAL CLINICAL NOTES

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2018
Patient: 67-year-old male software developer
Chief Complaint: Progressive neurological symptoms with right-sided predominance

MRI FINDINGS:
- 4.2 cm left frontal parasagittal meningioma
- Significant peritumoral edema
- Mass effect on motor cortex
- Enhancement pattern suggestive of WHO Grade II
KPS: 70 | ECOG: 1

ASSESSMENT & PLAN:
Given size, location, and symptomatic presentation, immediate surgical intervention recommended. Occupation requires fine motor skills and cognitive precision - delay could impact professional function.

SURGICAL INTERVENTION - March 28, 2018
- Simpson Grade II resection performed
- Subtotal removal due to superior sagittal sinus involvement
- Pathology confirms WHO Grade II meningioma
- Post-op KPS: 60 | ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - June 15, 2018
- Improved right-sided weakness
- Starting adjuvant radiation therapy
- 54 Gy in 30 fractions planned
KPS: 80 | ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - December 20, 2018
- Post-radiation imaging shows no progression
- Returned to work part-time
- Mild fatigue persists
KPS: 85 | ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - June 10, 2019
- MRI shows small area of enhancement at resection margin
- Watchful waiting approach
- Working full-time
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 0

URGENT VISIT - March 5, 2020
- New onset seizures
- MRI shows tumor progression
- Second surgery recommended
KPS: 70 | ECOG: 1

SECOND SURGERY - March 20, 2020
- More aggressive resection achieved
- Pathology shows transformation to WHO Grade III
- Post-op complications with infection
KPS: 50 | ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - September 15, 2020
- Post-treatment MRI stable
- Started on temozolomide
- Limited work capacity
KPS: 60 | ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - March 10, 2021
- Disease progression despite treatment
- Considering clinical trial options
KPS: 40 | ECOG: 3

FOLLOW-UP - September 2021 - December 2023
- Multiple admissions for seizure management
- Progressive decline in functional status
- Palliative care involvement
KPS: 30-40 | ECOG: 3-4

FINAL NOTE - January 2024
- Significant disease progression
- Transitioned to hospice care
- Family support engaged
KPS: 20 | ECOG: 4

TREATMENT SUMMARY:
- Initial presentation → aggressive surgical approach
- Disease progression required multimodal therapy
- Course complicated by malignant transformation
- Total duration of care: 5 years, 10 months

KPS Score Range: 20-90 throughout course
ECOG Score Range: 0-4 throughout course

OUTCOME:
Despite aggressive initial intervention and multimodal therapy, patient experienced malignant transformation and progressive decline. Early intervention provided initial good outcome but disease biology ultimately determined prognosis.

Plan:

Plan: Adjuvant radiation therapy recommended

Patient ID: F46-O-DM
Diagnosis: Meningioma

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2018
MRI FINDINGS:
- 4.2 cm right sphenoid wing meningioma
- Significant mass effect on temporal lobe
- Moderate peritumoral edema
- Enhancement pattern consistent with WHO Grade II meningioma
- Compression of optic nerve noted

ASSESSMENT:
Patient presents with concerning neurological symptoms indicating progressive disease. Occupation requires high cognitive function and visual acuity. Given size, location, and symptomatology, immediate surgical intervention recommended.
WHO Grade: II (preliminary radiological assessment)
KPS Score: 80
ECOG: 1

TREATMENT PLAN:
1. Schedule craniotomy within 2 weeks
2. Pre-operative optimization of diabetes management
3. Neurosurgical consultation with ophthalmology

SURGICAL NOTE - March 30, 2018
- Simpson Grade II resection achieved
- Subtotal removal due to cavernous sinus involvement
- Minimal blood loss
- No immediate complications
Pathology confirms WHO Grade II meningioma
KPS Score: 70
ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - June 15, 2018
Post-operative MRI shows small residual tumor
Symptoms improving
Initiated adjuvant radiation therapy
KPS Score: 75
ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - December 20, 2018
Completed radiation therapy
Improved visual symptoms
Return to work part-time
KPS Score: 85
ECOG: 1

ANNUAL FOLLOW-UP - March 2019
Stable imaging
Full return to work
Minor residual facial numbness
KPS Score: 90
ECOG: 0

FOLLOW-UP - September 2019
MRI shows small area of enhancement
Close monitoring warranted
KPS Score: 85
ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - March 2020
Tumor progression noted
Second surgery recommended
KPS Score: 75
ECOG: 1

SECOND SURGERY - April 2020
Complete resection achieved
KPS Score: 65
ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - October 2020
Post-operative recovery satisfactory
No evidence of recurrence
KPS Score: 80
ECOG: 1

ANNUAL FOLLOW-UP - March 2021
Stable imaging
Return to full work duties
KPS Score: 90
ECOG: 0

FOLLOW-UP - March 2022
Continued stability
Annual monitoring recommended
KPS Score: 95
ECOG: 0

FOLLOW-UP - March 2023
Small area of enhancement noted
Increased monitoring frequency
KPS Score: 85
ECOG: 1

CURRENT VISIT - January 2024
Stable disease
Maintaining work performance
Regular monitoring continues
KPS Score: 90
ECOG: 0

TREATMENT SUMMARY:
- Initial presentation with WHO Grade II meningioma
- Two surgical interventions (2018, 2020)
- Complete course of radiation therapy
- Current status: Stable disease with regular monitoring
- Overall positive outcome with maintenance of professional function

KPS Score Range: 65-95 throughout treatment course
ECOG Score Range: 0-2 throughout treatment course

MONITORING PLAN:
- MRI every 6 months
- Regular ophthalmological assessment
- Diabetes management optimization
- Cognitive function assessment quarterly
- Continue current follow-up schedule
clinical_notes.conservative:
CLINICAL NOTES - NEUROSURGERY DEPARTMENT
Patient ID: F46-O-DM
Diagnosis: Right Sphenoid Wing Meningioma

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2018
MRI FINDINGS:
- 2.8 cm right sphenoid wing meningioma
- Minimal perilesional edema
- No significant mass effect
- Dural tail sign present

ASSESSMENT:
46-year-old female financial analyst presenting with progressive neurological symptoms. Given tumor size and location, watchful waiting approach initially recommended with close monitoring.

PLAN:
1. MRI surveillance every 6 months
2. Neurology referral for headache management
3. Ophthalmology consultation for vision assessment
4. Continue current medications
KPS: 90 ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - September 20, 2018
Minimal tumor growth (2.9 cm). Vision stable. Headaches improved with prophylactic therapy.
PLAN: Continue surveillance
KPS: 85 ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - March 12, 2019
Tumor stable. Patient reports improved concentration with workplace accommodations (larger monitor, reduced screen time).
PLAN: Continue monitoring
KPS: 90 ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - March 5, 2020
Slight tumor growth (3.1 cm). Increased headache frequency.
PLAN: 
- Increase monitoring frequency
- Consider radiation therapy if symptoms worsen
KPS: 80 ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - September 15, 2020
COVID-19 Telehealth visit
Stable symptoms. Managing work remotely.
PLAN: Continue current management
KPS: 85 ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - March 10, 2021
Tumor size 3.2 cm. Patient experiencing increased balance issues.
PLAN: 
- Physical therapy referral
- Discuss radiation therapy options
KPS: 75 ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - September 22, 2021
Post-radiation therapy assessment (completed fractionated RT)
Improved symptoms, especially balance and headaches
PLAN: Continue monitoring
KPS: 85 ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - March 15, 2022
Stable tumor size. Vision improved.
PLAN: Annual MRI surveillance
KPS: 90 ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - March 20, 2023
Tumor slightly decreased (3.0 cm). Patient back to full-time work.
PLAN: Continue annual monitoring
KPS: 95 ECOG: 0

FOLLOW-UP - February 15, 2024
Stable disease. Maintaining good quality of life.
PLAN: 
- Continue annual MRI
- Regular diabetes management
- Maintain workplace accommodations
KPS: 95 ECOG: 0

WHO Grade: I (based on imaging characteristics)

KPS Score Range Over Time: 75-95
ECOG Score Range Over Time: 0-2

Management Summary:
Conservative approach successful with radiation therapy intervention only when necessary. Patient maintained professional activities throughout treatment period with appropriate accommodations. Diabetes remained well-controlled, contributing to positive outcome.

Next Follow-up: February 2025

clinical_notes.aggressive:
CLINICAL NOTES - NEUROSURGERY DEPARTMENT
Patient ID: M59-O-MEN
Initial Visit: March 15, 2016

INITIAL CONSULTATION
Chief Complaint: Progressive neurological symptoms with suspected meningioma
Present Illness: 59-year-old male presenting with progressive headaches, right-sided visual disturbance, and gait instability.

IMAGING FINDINGS:
MRI reveals a 4.2 cm left frontal parasagittal meningioma with significant peritumoral edema. Mass effect on superior sagittal sinus with early venous compression. T2 sequence shows hyperintense signal suggesting aggressive growth pattern.

ASSESSMENT:
High-risk features present:
- Size >3cm
- Significant peritumoral edema
- Critical location near motor strip
- History of radiation exposure
WHO Grade: Likely Grade II (to be confirmed post-resection)
KPS Score: 80
ECOG: 1

PLAN:
Recommend immediate surgical intervention given symptomatic presentation and high-risk features.

-------------------

SURGICAL NOTE - April 2, 2016
Procedure: Left frontal craniotomy for tumor resection
Simpson Grade II resection achieved
Pathology confirms WHO Grade II meningioma
Post-op KPS: 70
ECOG: 2

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - July 15, 2016
Patient recovering well. Adjuvant radiation therapy completed (60 Gy/30 fractions)
Symptoms improving
KPS: 85
ECOG: 1

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - January 10, 2017
6-month MRI shows no recurrence
Neurological symptoms resolved
KPS: 90
ECOG: 0

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - July 2018
Minor enhancement noted on follow-up MRI
Recommend increased monitoring frequency
KPS: 85
ECOG: 1

-------------------

URGENT VISIT - March 2020
New onset seizures
MRI shows tumor recurrence (2.8 cm)
KPS: 60
ECOG: 2

-------------------

SECOND SURGERY - April 2020
Repeat resection with adjuvant chemotherapy
Post-op complications with wound healing
KPS: 50
ECOG: 3

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - September 2020
Recovery progressing slowly
Rehabilitation ongoing
KPS: 70
ECOG: 2

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - March 2022
Stable disease on imaging
Improved functional status
KPS: 80
ECOG: 1

-------------------

LATEST FOLLOW-UP - January 2024
Stable disease
Maintaining good quality of life
Regular CPAP use continues
Blood pressure well-controlled
KPS: 85
ECOG: 1

TREATMENT SUMMARY:
- Two surgical resections (2016, 2020)
- Complete course of radiation therapy
- Adjuvant chemotherapy
- Regular imaging surveillance
- Management of comorbidities

KPS Score Range: 50-90 throughout treatment course
ECOG Score Range: 0-3 throughout treatment course

CURRENT STATUS:
Patient maintains good functional status with stable disease. Continues regular monitoring with q6month MRI scans. Occupational status: Modified work schedule with accommodations for medical appointments.

clinical_notes.aggressive:

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2018
Patient: 53Y Male, Blood Type A
Chief Complaint: Progressive headaches, right facial numbness, balance issues

IMAGING:
Initial MRI reveals 4.2cm right petroclival meningioma with significant mass effect on brainstem and moderate peritumoral edema. Enhancement pattern suggests WHO Grade II. Evidence of compression of cranial nerves V, VII, and VIII.

ASSESSMENT:
Given tumor size, location, and symptomatic presentation, immediate surgical intervention recommended. Occupation as stage artist significantly impacted by current symptoms. WHO Grade II suspected.
KPS: 80/100
ECOG: 1

PLAN:
1. Schedule surgical resection within 2 weeks
2. Pre-operative optimization of blood pressure
3. Detailed neuropsychological evaluation
4. Functional MRI for surgical planning

SURGICAL NOTE - April 2, 2018
Performed right retrosigmoid approach for tumor resection. Simpson Grade II resection achieved. Intraoperative monitoring showed preservation of cranial nerve function.
Post-op KPS: 70/100
ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - July 15, 2018
Pathology confirmed WHO Grade II meningioma
Post-operative MRI shows small residual tumor (1.1cm)
Adjuvant radiation therapy initiated
KPS: 75/100
ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - January 10, 2019
Completed radiation therapy
Improvement in balance and facial sensation
Return to modified performance schedule
KPS: 85/100
ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - July 2019 - December 2023 (Bi-annual visits)
Regular MRI surveillance showing stable residual disease
Gradual improvement in performance status
Return to full stage activities by 2020
KPS ranging 90-95/100
ECOG: 0-1

RECENT VISIT - January 15, 2024
MRI shows small focus of enhancement suggesting possible recurrence
New onset occasional headaches
PLAN: Increased monitoring frequency to every 3 months
Consider repeat surgical intervention if progression confirmed
KPS: 85/100
ECOG: 1

TREATMENT SUMMARY (2018-2024):
- Initial Simpson Grade II resection
- Adjuvant radiation therapy
- Regular imaging surveillance
- Maintained performance career with brief interruption
- Current status: Under close monitoring for possible recurrence

2018 (Post-op): 70/100
2018 (Post-radiation): 75/100
2019-2023: 90-95/100
2024: 85/100

ECOG Score Timeline:

2018 (Post-op): 2
2019-2023: 0-1
2024: 1

ONGOING RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Quarterly MRI surveillance
2. Monthly neurological examinations
3. Consideration for repeat surgical intervention if progression confirmed
4. Continued blood pressure monitoring
5. Regular neuropsychological evaluations

clinical_notes.aggressive:
CLINICAL NOTES - NEUROSURGERY DEPARTMENT
Patient ID: M40-A-2015
Occupation: Researcher

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2015
Presenting Symptoms: Progressive headaches (3 months), right eye blurred vision, nausea, personality changes, concentration difficulties, recent left hand focal seizure.
MRI Findings: 4.2cm right frontal convexity meningioma with significant peritumoral edema, mass effect on frontal lobe. Enhancement pattern consistent with WHO Grade II meningioma.
KPS: 80/100
ECOG: 1
Plan: Recommend immediate surgical intervention given size, symptoms, and occupation requiring cognitive function.

SURGICAL NOTE - April 2, 2015
Procedure: Right frontal craniotomy for tumor resection
Simpson Grade II resection achieved
Pathology: WHO Grade II (Atypical) Meningioma
Post-op KPS: 70/100
ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - July 15, 2015
Status: Improving neurological function
Imaging: Post-op MRI shows small residual tumor (0.8cm)
Adjuvant Treatment: Initiated fractionated RT (60 Gy/30fx)
KPS: 85/100
ECOG: 1

6-MONTH FOLLOW-UP - October 2, 2015
Status: Completed RT, improved symptoms
Imaging: Stable residual disease
KPS: 90/100
ECOG: 1

ANNUAL FOLLOW-UP - April 15, 2016
Status: Working full-time, minimal symptoms
Imaging: No progression
KPS: 95/100
ECOG: 0

18-MONTH FOLLOW-UP - October 10, 2016
New symptoms: Mild headaches
Imaging: Small area of enhancement (1.2cm)
KPS: 90/100
ECOG: 1

URGENT VISIT - January 5, 2017
Status: Recurrent seizures
Imaging: Tumor progression (2.0cm)
KPS: 70/100
ECOG: 2
Plan: Second surgery scheduled

SECOND SURGERY - January 20, 2017
Procedure: Re-resection with improved margins
Pathology: Confirmed WHO Grade II
KPS: 65/100
ECOG: 2

2-YEAR FOLLOW-UP - April 2017 - April 2019
Quarterly MRIs: Stable disease
Status: Returned to work part-time
KPS: Ranging 80-90/100
ECOG: 1

5-YEAR MARK - April 2020
Status: Stable, working full-time
Imaging: No recurrence
KPS: 95/100
ECOG: 0

7-YEAR FOLLOW-UP - March 2022
Status: Occasional headaches
Imaging: Small enhancement (0.5cm)
KPS: 90/100
ECOG: 1

LATEST FOLLOW-UP - January 2024
Status: Stable disease, fully functional
Imaging: No progression
Current KPS: 95/100
Current ECOG: 0

TREATMENT SUMMARY:
- Initial presentation with WHO Grade II meningioma
- Two surgical interventions (2015, 2017)
- Complete course of radiation therapy
- Regular imaging surveillance
- KPS range throughout treatment: 65-95
- Current status: Excellent recovery, maintained cognitive function crucial for research work
- Monitoring continues with bi-annual MRI

CURRENT RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Continue bi-annual MRI surveillance
2. Annual neuropsychological assessment
3. Maintain anticonvulsant therapy
4. Regular occupational health assessments
5. Low threshold for intervention if new symptoms develop

Management successfully preserved cognitive function critical for research career while achieving tumor control through minimal intervention approach.

CLINICAL NOTES - NEUROSURGERY DEPARTMENT
Patient ID: M43-O-2018
Occupation: Software Developer/Coffee Roaster

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2018
MRI FINDINGS:
- 4.2cm right frontal convexity meningioma
- Significant peritumoral edema
- Mass effect on right frontal lobe
- Compression of superior sagittal sinus
WHO Grade: II (atypical features noted)
KPS: 80 ECOG: 1

ASSESSMENT & PLAN:
Given size, symptoms, and occupation requiring cognitive focus, immediate surgical intervention recommended. Patient's work in software development demands optimal cognitive function. Headaches and visual symptoms suggest increasing ICP.

SURGICAL INTERVENTION - April 3, 2018
- Simpson Grade II resection performed
- Post-op MRI shows near-total resection
- Small residual along sagittal sinus
KPS: 70 ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - July 15, 2018
- Adjuvant radiotherapy completed (60 Gy/30 fractions)
- Improved vision and headaches
- Returning to work part-time
KPS: 85 ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - January 10, 2019
- Stable imaging
- Full return to work
- Minor fatigue reported
KPS: 90 ECOG: 0

FOLLOW-UP - July 8, 2019
- No evidence of recurrence
- Cognitive function optimal
KPS: 95 ECOG: 0

FOLLOW-UP - January 15, 2020
MRI shows small enhancement at resection site
- Increased monitoring frequency recommended
KPS: 90 ECOG: 0

URGENT VISIT - August 20, 2020
- New onset seizures
- MRI shows tumor recurrence (2.1cm)
- Second surgery recommended
KPS: 75 ECOG: 1

SECOND SURGERY - September 15, 2020
- Complete resection achieved
- WHO Grade II confirmed
KPS: 65 ECOG: 2

FOLLOW-UP - March 10, 2021
- Post-radiation recovery
- Return to work planned
KPS: 80 ECOG: 1

FOLLOW-UP - September 2021
- Stable imaging
- Full work resumption
KPS: 90 ECOG: 0

FOLLOW-UP - March 2022
- Continued stability
- Annual monitoring recommended
KPS: 95 ECOG: 0

FOLLOW-UP - March 2023
- No evidence of recurrence
- Maintaining full work schedule
KPS: 95 ECOG: 0

LATEST FOLLOW-UP - February 2024
- 6-year surveillance
- Stable imaging
- Excellent functional status
KPS: 100 ECOG: 0

TREATMENT SUMMARY:
- Initial presentation: WHO Grade II meningioma
- Two surgical interventions (2018, 2020)
- Adjuvant radiation therapy
- Current status: No evidence of disease

MONITORING PROTOCOL:
- MRI every 6 months for 5 years, then annually
- Neurological examination every 3 months
- Cognitive assessment every 6 months
- Quality of life evaluation ongoing

Final KPS: 100
Final ECOG: 0

Note: Patient's cognitive demands as a software developer and physical demands as a coffee roaster were key factors in aggressive treatment approach. Excellent outcome achieved with multimodal therapy.
clinical_notes.conservative:
NEUROSURGICAL CLINICAL NOTES

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2018
Patient: 43-year-old male software developer/coffee roaster
MRI FINDINGS: 2.8cm left frontal convexity meningioma with minimal surrounding edema, WHO Grade I
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 1

ASSESSMENT:
Given the patient's presenting symptoms and MRI findings, while the tumor is approaching our 3cm threshold, I recommend initiating with conservative management due to:
- Minimal peritumoral edema
- No critical structure involvement
- Patient's relatively young age and professional cognitive demands

PLAN:
1. Serial MRI monitoring every 6 months initially
2. Prophylactic anti-epileptic medication not indicated
3. Lifestyle modifications:
   - Reduced screen time with regular breaks
   - Ergonomic workplace assessment
   - Avoiding coffee roasting fumes temporarily
4. Symptomatic management:
   - Sumatriptan for migraine episodes
   - BP monitoring

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - September 20, 2018
Tumor stable at 2.8cm
Headaches improved with lifestyle modifications
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 1

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - March 12, 2019
Minimal growth (2.9cm)
Vision symptoms stable
KPS: 85 | ECOG: 1

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - March 10, 2020
Tumor size stable
Patient reports improved concentration with implemented breaks
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 1

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - March 15, 2021
Slight growth to 3.1cm
Increased headache frequency
PLAN: Maintain conservative approach but increase monitoring frequency
KPS: 80 | ECOG: 1

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - September 20, 2021
Tumor stable at 3.1cm
Started low-dose propranolol for headache prophylaxis
KPS: 85 | ECOG: 1

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - March 18, 2022
No further growth
Symptoms stable
Transitioned to annual MRI
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 0

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - March 15, 2023
Tumor stable
Patient successfully managing work-life balance
Returned to coffee roasting with proper ventilation
KPS: 95 | ECOG: 0

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - March 12, 2024
Tumor remains stable at 3.1cm
All symptoms well-controlled
Maintaining annual MRI schedule
KPS: 95 | ECOG: 0

OVERALL PROGRESS:
- Successfully managed conservatively over 6 years
- Maintained high functional status
- Minimal impact on quality of life
- Patient adapted well to lifestyle modifications

KPS Range over monitoring period: 80-95
ECOG Range over monitoring period: 0-1

FUTURE RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Continue annual MRI
2. Maintain current lifestyle modifications
3. Regular BP monitoring
4. Annual ophthalmological examination
5. Immediate reporting of any new symptoms

The conservative approach has proven successful in this case, with the patient maintaining excellent quality of life and professional functionality while avoiding surgical intervention.

clinical_notes.aggressive:
CLINICAL NOTES - NEUROSURGERY DEPARTMENT
Patient ID: M47-O-2016
Primary Neurosurgeon: Dr. [Name]

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2016
PRESENTING SYMPTOMS: Progressive neurological symptoms including morning headaches, right eye visual disturbance, unsteady gait, cognitive difficulties, right-sided tinnitus, and focal seizures affecting left hand. Occupational performance as Financial Analyst notably impacted.

IMAGING:
Initial MRI reveals a 4.2cm right frontal convexity meningioma with significant peritumoral edema. Mass effect on adjacent frontal lobe with 5mm midline shift. T2 hyperintense with heterogeneous enhancement. No calcification noted.

ASSESSMENT:
WHO Grade II atypical meningioma suspected based on imaging characteristics
High-risk features:
- Size >3cm
- Significant peritumoral edema
- No calcification
- Critical location affecting cognitive functions
- History of radiation exposure (risk factor for aggressive behavior)

PLAN:
1. Urgent surgical resection recommended
2. Pre-operative optimization of blood pressure
3. Seizure prophylaxis with Levetiracetam 500mg BID
4. Dexamethasone 4mg QID for edema
KPS: 70 | ECOG: 1

SURGICAL NOTE - March 28, 2016
Procedure: Right frontal craniotomy for tumor resection
Simpson Grade II resection achieved
Estimated blood loss: 300cc
No complications
Pathology confirms WHO Grade II meningioma
KPS: 60 | ECOG: 2

POST-OP FOLLOW-UP - May 15, 2016
Healing well
Adjuvant radiation therapy initiated
Started return-to-work planning
KPS: 80 | ECOG: 1

6-MONTH FOLLOW-UP - September 30, 2016
MRI shows no residual/recurrent tumor
Completed radiation therapy
Returned to work part-time
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 0

ANNUAL FOLLOW-UP - March 15, 2017
Stable imaging
Full work resumption
Minor fatigue
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 0

FOLLOW-UP - September 15, 2017
New 1.2cm nodule noted at resection margin
KPS: 85 | ECOG: 1

SURGICAL NOTE - October 30, 2017
Second resection performed
Simpson Grade I achieved
KPS: 70 | ECOG: 1

2019 ANNUAL FOLLOW-UP - March 15, 2019
Stable imaging
Working full-time
Weight management program initiated
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 0

2021 FOLLOW-UP - March 15, 2021
Small recurrence noted
Gamma Knife radiosurgery performed
KPS: 80 | ECOG: 1

2023 FOLLOW-UP - March 15, 2023
Stable disease
Maintaining work performance
Improved weight management
KPS: 95 | ECOG: 0

CURRENT STATUS (2024) - January 15, 2024
No evidence of recurrence
Regular cognitive assessments stable
Maintaining full work schedule
Continue q6month MRI surveillance
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 0

TREATMENT SUMMARY:
- Initial Simpson II resection (2016)
- Adjuvant radiation therapy
- Second Simpson I resection (2017)
- Gamma Knife for small recurrence (2021)
- Aggressive monitoring protocol maintained

KPS Score Range: 60-95 throughout treatment course
ECOG Score Range: 0-2 throughout treatment course

MONITORING PROTOCOL:
- MRI every 6 months
- Quarterly neurocognitive assessments
- Regular ophthalmological evaluations
- Monthly blood pressure monitoring
- Annual comprehensive metabolic panels

- Working reduced hours

clinical_notes.conservative:
NEUROSURGICAL CLINICAL NOTES

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2018
Patient: 62-year-old female librarian
MRI FINDINGS: 2.8cm right frontal convexity meningioma with minimal surrounding edema, WHO Grade I
KPS: 80 | ECOG: 1

ASSESSMENT & PLAN:
Given the patient's presenting symptoms and MRI findings, while surgical intervention could be considered, I'm recommending a conservative initial approach with close monitoring. Patient's occupation requires cognitive clarity but allows for flexible adaptation of duties.

RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Anti-epileptic: Levetiracetam 500mg BID
2. Dexamethasone 4mg BID with taper over 2 weeks for edema
3. Monthly neurological assessments for first 3 months
4. Follow-up MRI in 3 months

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - June 20, 2018
Tumor stable. Symptoms improved with medical management.
KPS: 85 | ECOG: 1
Plan: Continue current management, MRI in 6 months

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - January 10, 2019
Minimal tumor growth (0.2cm). Symptoms stable.
KPS: 80 | ECOG: 1
Plan: Maintain conservative approach, next MRI in 6 months

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - July 15, 2019
Patient reports increased headache frequency
MRI shows slight increase in peritumoral edema
KPS: 70 | ECOG: 2
Plan: Increase dexamethasone temporarily, consider radiation therapy consultation

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - January 20, 2020
Post-radiation therapy assessment (completed fractionated RT)
KPS: 75 | ECOG: 1
Tumor showing minor shrinkage
Plan: Continue monitoring, MRI in 6 months

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - August 5, 2020
COVID-19 Telehealth visit
Stable symptoms, managing work from home
KPS: 80 | ECOG: 1
Plan: Maintain current management

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - February 12, 2021
MRI stable, symptoms well-controlled
KPS: 85 | ECOG: 1
Plan: Annual MRI moving forward

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - March 3, 2022
Stable disease, working part-time
KPS: 90 | ECOG: 0
Plan: Continue annual monitoring

-------------------

FOLLOW-UP - April 15, 2023
Minor balance issues returned
MRI shows small increase in edema
KPS: 75 | ECOG: 1
Plan: Short course of dexamethasone, continue monitoring

-------------------

LATEST FOLLOW-UP - January 10, 2024
Symptoms stable, continuing part-time work
MRI unchanged from previous
KPS: 80 | ECOG: 1
Plan: Continue annual MRI, maintain current management

OVERALL DISEASE COURSE:
Patient has maintained relatively stable disease with conservative management. KPS scores ranged from 70-90 throughout the course, with temporary declines during periods of symptom exacerbation. The conservative approach has allowed her to continue working, though with reduced hours. Quality of life has been preserved with minimal intervention.

CURRENT RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Continue annual MRI surveillance
2. Maintain anti-epileptic medication
3. Regular cognitive assessments
4. Occupational therapy as needed
5. Consider full retirement if symptoms worsen

Final Status:
KPS Range over course: 70-90 (Currently 80)
ECOG Range over course: 0-2 (Currently 1)

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2018
Patient: 48-year-old female software developer
Chief Complaint: Progressive headaches, visual changes, and neurological symptoms

MRI FINDINGS:
- 2.4 cm left frontal parasagittal meningioma
- Minimal surrounding edema
- No significant mass effect
- WHO Grade I (likely)
- No calcification noted

ASSESSMENT:
Despite symptomatic presentation, tumor size and location favor initial conservative management. Patient's occupation requires significant screen time and cognitive focus, which influences management strategy.

PLAN:
1. Watchful waiting with close monitoring
2. Medical management of symptoms:
   - Dexamethasone 4mg daily for edema
   - Continue sumatriptan for migraines
3. Quarterly MRI for first year
4. Occupational recommendations:
   - Blue light filters for computer screens
   - Regular breaks using 20-20-20 rule
   - Ergonomic workspace assessment

KPS Score: 90
ECOG Score: 1

FOLLOW-UP - June 20, 2018
Mild improvement in symptoms with steroid therapy. No tumor growth.
Plan: Begin steroid taper.
KPS Score: 90
ECOG Score: 1

FOLLOW-UP - December 5, 2018
Stable symptoms, no tumor growth.
Plan: Continue monitoring, extend MRI interval to 6 months.
KPS Score: 95
ECOG Score: 0

FOLLOW-UP - June 15, 2019
Minor increase in headaches. MRI shows 2mm growth.
Plan: Resume low-dose dexamethasone, continue monitoring.
KPS Score: 85
ECOG Score: 1

Stable disease. Patient managing work with accommodations.
Plan: Annual MRI if stable.

ECOG Score: 1

Additional recommendations for workspace ergonomics.
KPS Score: 85
ECOG Score: 1

Plan: Consider radiation therapy if symptoms worsen.
KPS Score: 80
ECOG Score: 1

Patient experiencing increased visual symptoms.
Plan: Referral to radiation oncology for consultation while maintaining conservative approach.
KPS Score: 75
ECOG Score: 2

Tumor now 3.0cm. Patient opted for fractionated RT.

KPS Score: 70
ECOG Score: 2

- Conservative management maintained for 6 years
- Successful symptom management through medical therapy
- Quality of life preserved with occupational adjustments

The patient's KPS scores ranged from 95 (near normal function) to 70 (requires occasional assistance), reflecting the gradual progression of symptoms while maintaining independent function. ECOG scores remained relatively stable between 0-2, indicating preserved ability to work throughout most of the monitoring period.

Patient ID: F65-B-SD
Primary Diagnosis: Meningioma

MRI FINDINGS:
- 4.2 cm left frontotemporal meningioma
- Significant peritumoral edema
- Mass effect with 5mm midline shift
- Enhancement pattern suggestive of WHO Grade II
- Compression of left optic tract

ASSESSMENT:
Symptomatic WHO Grade II meningioma requiring urgent intervention. Patient's cognitive symptoms affecting work performance as software developer. High-risk features present.

PLAN:
1. Scheduled for surgical resection within 2 weeks
2. Pre-operative optimization with dexamethasone 4mg QID
3. Seizure prophylaxis with levetiracetam 500mg BID
KPS: 70 | ECOG: 1

-------------------

POST-OPERATIVE VISIT - April 12, 2016
PROCEDURE:
Left frontotemporal craniotomy with Simpson Grade II resection
PATHOLOGY: WHO Grade II atypical meningioma
COMPLICATIONS: None

PLAN:
1. Adjuvant radiation therapy (60 Gy/30 fractions)
2. Monthly follow-up
KPS: 60 | ECOG: 2

-------------------

6-MONTH FOLLOW-UP - October 15, 2016
IMAGING:
No evidence of residual/recurrent tumor
Resolving post-operative changes

SYMPTOMS:
- Improved vision
- Resolved headaches
- Mild word-finding difficulties persist

PLAN:
1. Continue q3month MRI surveillance
2. Speech therapy referral
KPS: 80 | ECOG: 1

-------------------

2-YEAR FOLLOW-UP - March 20, 2018
IMAGING:
2cm recurrence at original site
New satellite lesion (1.1cm)

PLAN:
1. Stereotactic radiosurgery to both lesions
2. Increase surveillance frequency
KPS: 75 | ECOG: 1

-------------------

3-YEAR FOLLOW-UP - April 15, 2019
IMAGING:
Stable post-radiation changes
No new lesions

SYMPTOMS:
- Working part-time
- Manageable fatigue
- No seizures

PLAN:
Continue q4month surveillance
KPS: 85 | ECOG: 1

-------------------

5-YEAR FOLLOW-UP - March 10, 2021
IMAGING:
Multiple new lesions (largest 2.8cm)
Increasing edema

SYMPTOMS:
Recurrent headaches
Worsening cognitive function

PLAN:
1. Second craniotomy for largest lesion
2. Consider systemic therapy
KPS: 50 | ECOG: 2

-------------------

7-YEAR FOLLOW-UP - May 15, 2023
IMAGING:
Progressive disease despite treatment
Significant mass effect

SYMPTOMS:
- Severely impaired cognition
- Unable to work
- Dependent for ADLs

PLAN:
1. Palliative care consultation
2. Hospice discussion
KPS: 40 | ECOG: 3

-------------------

FINAL VISIT - January 10, 2024
Status: Progressive neurological decline
Transitioned to hospice care
KPS: 30 | ECOG: 4

TREATMENT SUMMARY:
- Initial Simpson Grade II resection (2016)
- Adjuvant radiation therapy
- Stereotactic radiosurgery (2018)
- Second craniotomy (2021)
- Multiple courses of systemic therapy

ECOG Score Range: 1-4

INITIAL VISIT - March 15, 2018
Patient: 62-year-old male, Blood Type O

PRESENTING SYMPTOMS:
- Progressive morning headaches (3-month duration)
- Right-sided facial numbness
- Anosmia affecting professional wine tasting ability
- Word-finding difficulties
- Balance issues
- Mild nausea
- Progressive fatigue

IMAGING:
MRI reveals 3.8cm left frontal convexity meningioma with significant peritumoral edema. Mass effect on frontal lobe with midline shift of 5mm. T2 hyperintense with heterogeneous enhancement.

ASSESSMENT:
WHO Grade II meningioma suspected due to irregular borders and significant edema. Given patient's occupation requiring fine olfactory discrimination and cognitive function, immediate intervention recommended.

TREATMENT PLAN:
1. Schedule surgical resection within 2 weeks
2. Preoperative dexamethasone 4mg QID
3. Anticonvulsant prophylaxis
KPS: 80 ECOG: 1

-------------------

Minimal residual tumor at skull base attachment.
Recommended adjuvant radiation therapy.
KPS: 70 ECOG: 2

-------------------

Post-radiation assessment
Completed 54 Gy in 30 fractions
Improved symptoms, minimal residual facial numbness
MRI shows no progression
KPS: 85 ECOG: 1

Stable imaging
Returned to work with accommodations
Partial recovery of olfactory function
KPS: 90 ECOG: 1

MRI shows small enhancement at surgical site
Watchful waiting approach
No new symptoms
KPS: 90 ECOG: 1

-------------------

Evidence of tumor progression (1.2cm growth)
New onset headaches
Recommended repeat surgical intervention
KPS: 75 ECOG: 1

-------------------

Complete resection achieved
Pathology confirms recurrent WHO Grade II
Started on temozolomide
KPS: 65 ECOG: 2

-------------------

Good response to treatment
No evidence of recurrence
Returned to modified work schedule

-------------------

Stable imaging
Maintaining work activities
Minor balance issues persist

No new symptoms
Continues modified work schedule
Regular monitoring to continue
KPS: 95 ECOG: 0

Patient ID: M63-O-2016
Occupation: Financial Analyst

Initial Visit - March 15, 2016
PRESENTING SYMPTOMS: Progressive neurological symptoms including morning headaches, right eye visual disturbance, cognitive changes, and balance issues. Concerning for space-occupying lesion.

IMAGING: MRI reveals 4.2cm left frontal convexity meningioma with significant peritumoral edema. Mass effect on adjacent frontal lobe with 5mm midline shift. T2 hyperintense with heterogeneous enhancement.

ASSESSMENT: WHO Grade II Meningioma (suspected based on imaging characteristics)
PLAN: Recommend urgent surgical resection given size, symptoms, and prior radiation exposure history.
KPS: 80 ECOG: 1

-------------------

Post-Op Visit - April 2, 2016
PROCEDURE: Left frontal craniotomy with gross total resection
PATHOLOGY: Confirmed WHO Grade II atypical meningioma
COMPLICATIONS: None
PLAN: Initiate adjuvant radiation therapy
KPS: 70 ECOG: 1

-------------------

Follow-up - October 15, 2016
STATUS: Completed 60 Gy/30fx radiation therapy
SYMPTOMS: Improved vision and headaches. Mild fatigue persists.
IMAGING: Post-treatment MRI shows no residual tumor
PLAN: Continue q4 month surveillance
KPS: 85 ECOG: 1

-------------------

Annual Review - March 20, 2017
SYMPTOMS: Generally stable. Minor memory complaints.
IMAGING: No evidence of recurrence
PLAN: Continue surveillance
KPS: 90 ECOG: 0

-------------------

Follow-up - February 12, 2019
SYMPTOMS: New onset intermittent headaches
IMAGING: Small 1.2cm recurrence at original site
PLAN: Stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS) scheduled
KPS: 85 ECOG: 1

-------------------

Post-SRS Review - June 15, 2019
TREATMENT: Completed SRS (16 Gy single fraction)
SYMPTOMS: Stable
PLAN: Continue q4 month monitoring
KPS: 80 ECOG: 1

-------------------

Follow-up - March 10, 2021
SYMPTOMS: Progressive right-sided weakness
IMAGING: Multiple new lesions, largest 2.3cm
PLAN: Second craniotomy scheduled
KPS: 60 ECOG: 2

-------------------

Post-Op Review - April 30, 2021
PROCEDURE: Repeat left frontal craniotomy
PATHOLOGY: WHO Grade III progression
COMPLICATIONS: Post-op speech deficit
PLAN: Initiate temozolomide chemotherapy
KPS: 50 ECOG: 2

-------------------

Final Note - January 15, 2024

SYMPTOMS: Significant functional decline, requiring assistance
PLAN: Palliative care consultation
KPS: 40 ECOG: 3

TREATMENT SUMMARY 2016-2024:
- Initial craniotomy with GTR (2016)
- Adjuvant radiation therapy
- SRS for first recurrence (2019)
- Second craniotomy (2021)
- Systemic therapy
- Progressive disease despite aggressive intervention

ECOG Score Range: 0-3
